New Records: Luis Arraez has not struck out in a whopping 110 plate appearances -- the longest single-season stretch by any player since Juan Pierre reached 147 in 2004.
Key Match Events: The Padres did not have Fernando Tatis Jr. and Jackson Merrill for eight innings.
Grant McCray hit two home runs, including a two-run shot in the ninth inning.
Fernando Tatis Jr. hit a double as a pinch-hitter in the ninth inning.
Ryan Walker retired the next three batters in order after Tatis' double.
Post-Match Reflections: Xander Bogaerts expressed frustration over missed opportunities and left too many runners on base.
Bogaerts emphasized the importance of moving on and focusing on the next game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Padres' lead over Arizona for the top Wild Card spot in the National League remains at 1 1/2 games.
The Padres' edge over Atlanta is three games.
Manny Machado is one home run away from becoming the franchise's all-time home run leader with 164.
